text:
“Do you trust me?” Razumihin asked, his eyes bright.

“Let us go, mother,” Avdotya Romanovna said. “He will keep his promise.”

Razumihin beamed. “You understand me, you are an angel! Nastasya! Go upstairs and sit with him. I’ll be there soon.”

Pulcheria Alexandrovna hesitated, but followed. Razumihin took their arms and led them down the stairs.

“Ah, I see you think I’m in a condition!” he laughed, striding ahead. “I’m drunk like a fool, but not from wine. It’s seeing you.”

He paused, breathless. “I love you both! Don’t be angry with me!”

**PAGE SUMMARY:** Razumihin expresses his deep affection and concern for Avdotya and her mother while assuring them of his commitment to help Rodya.
